column7: the boathouse - sleep in your own slip - unique property, boathouse over water
column11: Upper deck seemed unsafe with ancient furniture.
column13: Photos are deceiving. Outdoor shower rusted and falling apart used as storage. Camper for additional guest you could see dead insects and junk inside nobody could ever stay in there. Electrical was suspect with melted electrical outlets. Furniture dirty and from the 1980’s. Landscaping was let go with overgrown weeds and rusty pool screening and green pool to look at every day. Dock is dilapidated. Kayaks were both broken down with broken seats and in poor condition. SUP was not provided. Upper deck seemed unsafe with ancient furniture. Really low class. Do not plan on cooking just not feasible in the kitchenette. Also the owners are right there every day, they never go anywhere, so there is no privacy at all. The owners are all nice enough (4 adults). They just seem unable to do any kind of work or maintenance on the property. I just want future renters to know what to expect if they choose to rent.

column7: waterfront cottage on rocky creek - rate inclusive of all fees
column10: love location but not as clean as i like
column11: The deck was not safe and needed to be replaced.
column13:
Loved the house and location. We loved that we could sit outside and watch wildlife on the canal. Beautiful view. Unfortunately, the outside furniture was extremely dirty and moldy. We had to put a sheet over the cushion on the loveseat. The table had to be washed too. The deck was not safe and needed to be replaced. Fenced yard was great for the dog. 
We loved the house. It was roomy and comfortable. 
Inside was clean for the most part but I accidentally stuck my hand in grease left on the stove. Rug in master bed room has a corner the sticking up and is a trip hazard. Complain about it the 1st day and reminded them several times by text and email but it was 2 weeks before it was taped down. 
The neighborhood was good. Well maintained. House located on a court so no traffic. There was a unlicensed broken down car right next to the driveway that made it more difficult to back out of it. We were excited to have a garage but couldn’t use it due to the fact that it was full of stuff. It shouldn’t even be mentioned in the listing if you can’t park in it. 
We were there 3 weeks. We paid for a month but the day before we were leaving, my brother pasted away so we totally lost a whole week’s rent. Vrbo does not take into consideration the loss of an immediate family member.

column7: coral reef - 200m from the beach with ocean views
column10: good location, in need of an update
column11: The first floor deck also feels a little unsafe and probably needs some work.
column13: Property was clean and comfortable and in a great location. However, it’s a little tired and rough around the edges in certain areas. Most of the decor and fixtures (kitchen, bathrooms etc) are dated and could do with an update. The first floor deck also feels a little unsafe and probably needs some work. Could be great with a little investment.

column11: Balcony railing was deemed unsafe and we were warned not to touch or lean on it by maintenance.
column13: Good location & views but could use a deep cleaning, a few basic condiments besides salt & pepper, and instructions for parking, check out procedure, etc. Previous manager’s contact info was listed on the emails I received. Fortunately the new manager was listed on one email and was very helpful. Beds were comfortable, and there was relatively new furniture, granite countertops, etc. but unit definitely showed its age and lack of thorough cleaning. Balcony railing was deemed unsafe and we were warned not to touch or lean on it by maintenance. Definitely showing its age.

column7: heron lane house - windows to a secluded waterfront
column10: beautiful views, quiet location, light-filled spacious property
column11: On the less positive side: the deck and outside portions of the house show wear and neglect: moss is growing on much of it, with debris and green slick on others, some rotted boards, and a railing that fell off during out stay.
column13: The house is spectacularly situated for a sweeping view of the water and sky. It is mostly windows so the light is fantastic. There is plenty of room for spreading out inside: a large great room, open kitchen with everything you need, and beds are comfortable. We had a great stay, and the owner was responsive when we called with reports of two malfunctioning doors. On the less positive side: the deck and outside portions of the house show wear and neglect: moss is growing on much of it, with debris and green slick on others, some rotted boards, and a railing that fell off during out stay. The lights in the house are hard to figure out, and the fading magic marker scrawlings on the faceplates add no charm. The lower level storage space is messy, and we found a “surprise” in one of the drawers upstairs. A little more attention to detail and this will be a fantastic property.

column7: modern bach - level 5 minute walk to kuaotunu beach
column10: lovely, well equipped house. great location.
column11: I advise replacing all the nails in the deck with stainless steel screws before they become a trip or injury hazard.
column13: As above. 5mins walk to beach across the road. We had dinner on the deck most nights. I advise replacing all the nails in the deck with stainless steel screws before they become a trip or injury hazard. They are all "popping" and hammering them down again will not prevent this. It is caused by the timber shrinking and swelling.

column7: the log cabin (1 min to beach)
column11: · Backyard unsuitable for children to play in – zero shade · Back deck unsafe and in need repair/re-build – exposed nails extremely deteriorated timbers.
column13:
· Although it did not have air-conditioning, there is insufficient fans to cool the property adequately. Three rusty old fans were an insufficient source of cooling – the house felt was extremely uncomfortable on warmer days/nights.
· No window screens on the majority of windows. To cool the property it was necessary to open windows. This caused security concerns and also allowed insects into the property.
· Every window blind in the house was broken and would not function properly.
· Security screen doors could not be locked causing further security issues.
· No storage area to store bikes etc unless they were brought inside although, due to no functioning security screens and the requirement to leave windows open (with no screens) security of bikes etc was a concern.
· Backyard unsuitable for children to play in – zero shade
· Back deck unsafe and in need repair/re-build – exposed nails extremely deteriorated timbers.
· Lattice around back deck is rotten and falling apart – our dog kept going under the deck which caused some issues leaving toys etc underneath.
· The bunk beds swayed and did not feel structurally safe.
· Advertisement states the house is “basic” and “humble” – This is an strong understatement!
· Fantastic fridge – the kids loved the ice maker.
None of the photos on the website show what state the property is actually in. Very disappointing.

column7: the boathouse - sleep in your own slip - unique property, boathouse over water
column11: Upper deck seemed unsafe with ancient furniture.
column13: Photos are deceiving. Outdoor shower rusted and falling apart used as storage. Camper for additional guest you could see dead insects and junk inside nobody could ever stay in there. Electrical was suspect with melted electrical outlets. Furniture dirty and from the 1980’s. Landscaping was let go with overgrown weeds and rusty pool screening and green pool to look at every day. Dock is dilapidated. Kayaks were both broken down with broken seats and in poor condition. SUP was not provided. Upper deck seemed unsafe with ancient furniture. Really low class. Do not plan on cooking just not feasible in the kitchenette. This is a 120.00 a night VRBO not 220 that we paid. Also the owners are right there every day, they never go anywhere, so there is no privacy at all. The owners are all nice enough (4 adults). They just seem unable to do any kind of work or maintenance on the property. I just want future renters to know what to expect if they choose to rent.

column11: Also unsafe balcony rails, loose glass panels and loose cables from faulty work.
column13:
The property is in a lovely location and is a good size. But requires a bit of maintenance, with leaking shower heads and no drains in the bathrooms for the water. Also unsafe balcony rails, loose glass panels and loose cables from faulty work. The lock box for the property key was corroded up, also some sliding doors wouldn't slide or would fall of their rails.
The property is also like two separate residences as it's not very interconnected.
Finally was advertised as both a 6 bedroom and a 4 bedroom by Stayz which was very confusing 😕.

column7: 60's modern, mountain views, pool, near studios and all l.a. attractions! apt 17
column11: Slider was broken when we went (hosts left a message apologizing for inconvenience on slider) so could not use the balcony, but it was raining while we were there so that was not an issue for us.
column13: Location is great if you're visiting Universal Studios as it's only 10 min away. Hosts provided everything you would need and the place is very nice. Slider was broken when we went (hosts left a message apologizing for inconvenience on slider) so couldn't use the balcony, but it was raining while we were there so that wasn't an issue for us. Parking is basically street parking (just off street, but no gate or anything) so I was a bit concerned about break-ins, but nothing happened while we were there so my concern was for naught. Do pay attention to the "two flights of stairs" in the listing though as that was the only part that I wish I had put more thought in to :-). Overall, I would gladly stay here again.
